title: Philanthropic Hall, Davidson College
text:
Philanthropic Hall, Davidson College is a historic <a href="school">school</a> building located on the campus of <a href="Davidson%20College">Davidson College</a> at <a href="Davidson%2C%20North%20Carolina">Davidson</a>, <a href="Mecklenburg%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina">Mecklenburg County, North Carolina</a>. It was built in 1849–1850, and is a two-story, temple-form brick structure three bays wide and three bays long in the <a href="Greek%20Revival%20architecture">Greek Revival</a> style. The front facade features a prostyle tetrastyle <a href="Doric%20order">Doric order</a> pedimented <a href="portico">portico</a> supported by four massive <a href="stucco">stucco</a>ed brick columns. The building faces <a href="Eumenean%20Hall%2C%20Davidson%20College">Eumenean Hall</a> across the original quadrangle of Davidson College. It was converted to office use in 1956.
It was added to the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1972.
